ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.2_0: At that time nuns who had received the full admission did not follow their mentor for two years.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.4_0: and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.5_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns don’t do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.10_0: “... How can nuns not do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.12_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:1.13.1_0: ‘If a nun does not follow the mentor who gave her the full admission for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.5_0: Who gave her the full admission:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.8_0: the preceptor is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.10_0: Two years had a sense of urgency,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.12_0: does not herself attend on her.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.1.13_0: If she thinks, “I won’t pursue it for two years,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.2_0: if the preceptor is ignorant or shameless;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.6_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc69:2.2.7_0: The ninth training rule is finished.
